title: Projection matrix
summary: In statistics, the projection matrix ( P ) {\displaystyle (\mathbf {P} )} ,[1] sometimes also called the influence matrix[2] or hat matrix ( H ) {\displaystyle (\mathbf {H} )} , maps the vector of response values (dependent variable values) to the vector of fitted values (or predicted values). It describes the influence each response value has on each fitted value.[3][4] The diagonal elements of the projection matrix are the leverages, which describe the influence each response value has on the fitted value for that same observation.
